🏥 ADHS ETL Pipeline

Arizona Department of Health Services Provider Data Processing System

ℹ️ Project Overview

A Python-based ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) pipeline for processing healthcare provider data from the Arizona Department of Health Services (ADHS). The system processes monthly provider roster Excel workbooks, performs data standardization, deduplication, and generates comprehensive business analysis reports.

🎯 Core Purpose & Functionality

This pipeline processes ADHS provider data across 11 different healthcare facility types, transforming raw Excel workbooks into standardized, deduplicated datasets with business intelligence analysis. It handles:

  • Monthly data ingestion from multiple provider types
  • Field mapping and standardization
  • Provider deduplication using fuzzy matching
  • Historical tracking and change analysis
  • Geocoding integration (planned via MCAO API)
  • Comprehensive business analysis reporting

🔄 Data Processing Pipeline

Input
Excel Files
11 Provider Types
→
Transform
Field Mapping
Standardization
→
Analyze
Deduplication
Change Detection
→
Output
3 Excel Reports
Business Insights

📁 Project Structure

adhs-restore-28-Jul-2025/
├── src/
│   ├── adhs_etl/          # Main application code
│   │   ├── cli.py          # Command-line interface
│   │   ├── config.py       # Pydantic settings
│   │   ├── transform.py    # Data transformation
│   │   ├── analysis.py     # Business analysis
│   │   └── runner.py       # ETL orchestration
│   └── tests/              # Test suite (≥80% coverage)
├── scripts/                # Batch processing utilities
├── ALL-MONTHS/            # Historical data archive
├── Raw-New-Month/         # Current month input
├── Reformat/              # Standardized output
├── All-to-Date/           # Cumulative data
├── Analysis/              # Business analysis reports
└── field_map.yml          # Column mapping configuration

🏥 Provider Types Processed

Assisted Living

Assisted Living Homes

Nursing Care

Nursing Homes

Behavioral Health

Outpatient Clinics & Residential

Adult Care

Adult Care Homes & Day Health

Child Services

Development Homes & Welfare

Substance Abuse

Treatment Transitional Facilities

📊 Output Files Generated

Output Type Format Description Key Features
Reformat M.YY Reformat.xlsx Standardized monthly data 11 standard columns, provider grouping
All-to-Date Reformat All to Date M.YY.xlsx Cumulative historical data All months combined, deduplicated
Analysis M.YY Analysis.xlsx Business intelligence report 77 columns, lost license detection, MCAO data

🔧 Technical Implementation

Core Technologies

  • Python 3.11+ - Primary language
  • Poetry - Dependency management
  • Pandas - Data processing
  • Pydantic - Configuration validation
  • RapidFuzz - Fuzzy string matching (85% threshold)
  • Typer - CLI framework

Key Features

Smart Field Mapping

Automatic detection and tracking of unknown columns in field_map.TODO.yml

Provider Deduplication

Address matching (first 20 chars) + name fuzzy matching (85% threshold)

Dry Run Mode

Safe testing without modifying files

Comprehensive Testing

≥80% code coverage requirement

💻 Usage Examples

CLI Commands

# Process January 2025 data
poetry run adhs-etl run --month 1.25 --raw-dir ./Raw-New-Month

# Dry run mode for testing
poetry run adhs-etl run --month 1.25 --raw-dir ./Raw-New-Month --dry-run

# Batch processing multiple months
poetry run python scripts/batch_process_months.py

# Validate field mappings
poetry run adhs-etl validate --field-map field_map.yml

🚀 Development Workflow

⚠️ Important Development Rules

  • No direct commits to main - Always use PRs with review
  • Configuration access - Only via from adhs_etl.config import Settings
  • Commit messages - Follow Conventional Commits (feat:, fix:, chore:)
  • File naming - Python: snake_case.py, Markdown: kebab-case.md
  • Large files - Place >5MB files in /data (git-ignored)

🔮 Future Enhancements

✅ Planned Features

  • MCAO API Integration - Real-time geocoding and property data
  • Enhanced Analytics - Trend analysis and predictive modeling
  • Performance Optimization - Parallel processing for large datasets
  • Web Dashboard - Interactive visualization of provider data

📋 Project Context

This project appears to be part of a larger healthcare data management system for Arizona, specifically focused on tracking and analyzing various types of healthcare providers. The sophisticated deduplication and grouping logic suggests it's handling real-world data with potential duplicates and variations in provider information.

The pipeline's ability to track historical changes and identify lost licenses indicates it's used for compliance monitoring and regulatory oversight. The planned MCAO (Maricopa County Assessor's Office) integration suggests property ownership and location verification are important aspects of the analysis.

content.text:
## Summary

I've analyzed the ADHS ETL Pipeline project and created a comprehensive visual report. Here's my understanding:

**Project Overview:**
This is a sophisticated Python-based ETL pipeline for processing healthcare provider data from the Arizona Department of Health Services. It handles monthly data from 11 different provider types (nursing homes, assisted living, behavioral health facilities, etc.) and performs complex data transformation, deduplication, and business analysis.

**Key Technical Highlights:**
- Built with Python 3.11+, using Poetry for dependency management
- Implements smart field mapping with automatic unknown column detection
- Uses fuzzy string matching (85% threshold) for provider deduplication
- Generates three types of output: Reformat (standardized), All-to-Date (cumulative), and Analysis (business intelligence)
- Maintains ≥80% test coverage requirement
- Includes dry-run mode for safe testing

**Notable Architecture Decisions:**
- Pydantic-based configuration management
- Modular design with separate transform, analysis, and runner components
- Batch processing capabilities for handling multiple months
- Planned MCAO API integration for geocoding and property data

The project follows strict development practices including PR-based workflows, conventional commits, and specific file naming conventions. It appears to be used for regulatory compliance and provider monitoring in Arizona's healthcare system.

I've opened the detailed HTML report in your browser: `/tmp/cc_genui_adhs_project_summary_20250116_150300.html`

content.text:
✅ **All dependencies have been installed successfully!**

The project now has all required dependencies:
- **Core**: pandas, openpyxl, rapidfuzz, pydantic, psutil
- **CLI**: typer with all extras
- **Config**: python-dotenv, pydantic-settings  
- **Added**: pyyaml (was missing)
- **Dev**: pytest, pytest-cov, ruff, black

The ETL pipeline is ready to use. You can now run:
```bash
poetry run python scripts/batch_process_months.py
```

The minor Typer warning about `make_metavar()` doesn't affect functionality - it's just a display issue with the help text. The batch script should work properly now.
